description: Terminology glossary for Divan-e Kabir translation. Ensures consistency across the corpus.

terms.notes: Divine love, the cosmic force driving creation. Capital L when referring to Love as cosmic principle. Not mere romantic love.
Always capital B. Deliberately ambiguous: may refer to God, Shams, or human beloved simultaneously. Never collapse to single meaning.
Can also be 'the Beloved' depending on context. Capital F when divine.
Divine friend. Capital F.
The spiritual essence, not just 'life'. Sometimes 'spirit' if context demands.
Seat of spiritual perception in Sufi thought, not mere emotion or sentimentality.
Mystical intoxication with divine presence. Not literal alcohol. Context usually makes this clear.
Spiritually drunk with divine presence. 'Drunk' also acceptable.
The one who pours the wine of divine love. Often refers to the spiritual master or God.
The place of spiritual intoxication. Keep as 'tavern' - the Sufi meaning is understood.
Annihilation of ego in the divine. Technical Sufi term. Can use 'fana' with gloss on first occurrence.
Remaining/subsisting in God after fana. Technical Sufi term.
The whirling ceremony; mystical listening. Keep as 'sama' with gloss, or 'spiritual audition'.
Keep as 'khanaqah' or 'Sufi lodge'.
Symbol of the soul separated from its divine origin. Always 'reed-flute' or 'reed', never just 'flute'.
Where the reed was cut from; symbol of the divine origin.
The sacred house in Mecca. Always 'Kaaba', never 'cube' or generic.
The Islamic salat. Translate as 'prayer' but preserve Islamic context in notes.
Bowing posture in Islamic prayer. Use 'ruku' or 'bowing in prayer'.
Prostration in Islamic prayer. Use 'sajda/sujud' or 'prostration in prayer'.
Pilgrimage to Mecca. Always 'Hajj', never 'pilgrimage' alone.
Direction of prayer (toward Mecca). Keep as 'qibla'.
Shams al-Din Tabrizi, Rumi's spiritual beloved. Always proper noun. Note: 'shams' also means 'sun' - wordplay often present.
Title meaning 'our master'. Refers to Rumi himself.
Sufi mystic/mendicant. Keep as 'dervish'.
Islamic mystic. Always capitalize.
The tavern of spiritual ruin; place where ego is destroyed. 'Ruins' or 'tavern of ruin'.
Divine unity (tawhid). The oneness of God and existence.
The apparent multiplicity of creation, contrasted with divine unity.
A transient spiritual state given by God. Technical Sufi term.
A permanent spiritual station achieved through effort. Technical Sufi term.
Remembrance of God; repetitive prayer. Keep as 'dhikr' or 'remembrance'.
Symbol of the beloved's tall, graceful stature. Common Persian poetic image.
Symbol of the lover; sings for the rose (beloved).
Symbol of the beloved's beauty. The nightingale's object of love.
Often represents divine love burning away the ego.
Symbol of humility, mortality, or the material world.
Often carries messages or represents spirit/breath.
Life-giving; sometimes represents divine grace.
